text: So, I've been studying the discovery code this morning, POSSIBLE's looks more complex, but it uses the ad-hoc network approach, SFCD's is simpler and uses a NodeJS websocket server similar to what we did before
I'm sure we can come up with something useful based on these codebases and our existing knowledge in this area
The ad-hoc network idea seems more aligned toward a future SDK than the remote server idea (making developers set up their own node sync service seems awkward for an android SDK)
had great luck with it in stride, have no reason to believe a remote server should even get involved unless completely necessary
I think the P2P is probably the best arch overall. I still haven't been able to run the video test one. I think thats the one that has the server component?
I haven't run any of them, I was just exploring the code and thinking about it
<!channel>: We'll do our call at 2:30 today.
